Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the remains of a missing woman were found on the property of Bill and Hillary Clinton. This is not supported by any evidence.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the remains found were those of a missing woman.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the story was published by a known purveyor of fake news and is entirely fabricated.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the remains found are linked to the Clintons without any factual basis.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the remains found may not be connected to the Clintons at all, as the story is fabricated.
